title: Half-Subtractor
content: - A half-subtractor is a combinational circuit that subtracts two single-bit binary numbers.
It has two inputs: minuend (A) and subtrahend (B).
It produces two outputs: difference (D) and borrow (Bo).
The difference output represents the result of the subtraction.
The borrow output indicates whether a borrow is needed from the next higher bit position.

The Boolean expressions for the half-subtractor are:
    - D = A'B + AB' (XOR gate)
    - Bo = A'B (AND gate with complemented A)
image_desc: A logic diagram of a half-subtractor with inputs A and B, and outputs D and Bo.
narration: A half-subtractor is a fundamental building block in digital circuits used for binary subtraction. It takes two single-bit inputs, the minuend and subtrahend, and produces two outputs: the difference and the borrow. The difference output represents the result of the subtraction, while the borrow output indicates whether a borrow is needed from the next higher bit position. The logic diagram shows how the half-subtractor is implemented using XOR and AND gates.

title: Full Subtractor
content: - A full subtractor is a combinational circuit that subtracts two single-bit binary numbers, taking into account a borrow from the previous bit position.
It has three inputs: minuend (A), subtrahend (B), and borrow-in (Cin).
It produces two outputs: difference (D) and borrow-out (Bout).
The difference output represents the result of the subtraction.
The borrow-out output indicates whether a borrow is needed for the next higher bit position.
image_desc: A truth table showing the inputs and outputs of a full subtractor.
narration: A full subtractor is an extension of the half-subtractor, capable of handling subtractions involving a borrow from the previous bit position. It has three inputs: the minuend, subtrahend, and borrow-in, and produces two outputs: the difference and the borrow-out. The truth table illustrates how the full subtractor operates for all possible input combinations.

title: Full Subtractor Logic Diagram
content:
- The Boolean expressions for the full subtractor are:
    - D = A'B'Cin + A'BCin' + AB'Cin' + ABCin
    - Bout = A'B'Cin + A'BCin' + A'BC + ABC
image_desc: A logic diagram of a full subtractor with inputs A, B, and Cin, and outputs D and Bout.
narration: The logic diagram of the full subtractor shows how the difference and borrow-out outputs are generated using a combination of XOR, AND, and NOT gates. The Boolean expressions for the outputs are derived from the truth table and represent the logical relationships between the inputs and outputs.
